author: johnh
msg: Adding Gadgets API JavaScript, including inter-domain communication library (IFPC) to Shindig. Also, adding initial support for type=URL gadgets, along with several cleanups, tweaks, and bugfixes.
Details:
* IFPC (Inter-frame procedure call) library, enabling container-to-gadget and gadget-to-container communication.
* Library declared in the namespace "gadgets.*".
* Backward compatibility maintained with iGoogle with the messaging protocol unchanged and an _IFPC alias defined in the global namespace.
* Base gadgets core JS functionality
* IO routines (eg. fetchContent APIs)
* User pref and localization message handling
* Backward-compatibility layer to ensure interoperability w/ existing gadgets.
* Fixed incorrect dependency handling in GadgetFeatureRegistry.
* Added support for loading all core JS from default locations (Configurability TBD)
* Adding initial type=URL gadget support.
* Works by constructing URL and redirecting to it.
* UserPrefs special-cased as up_<foo> arguments for now; to be generalized soon.
* Renamed BasicGadgetHttpServlet to GadgetRenderingServlet.
* Augmented JsLibrary with registration mechanism to allow references to JavaScript
libraries that implement various features by short name.
* Added JsServlet for serving JavaScript files registered as above.
+ Includes support for loading _all_ libs at once with no changes by Gadget developers.
Technique: libs=js/foo:bar:baz.js turned into <script src="gadget.com/gadgets/js/foo:bar:baz.js"/>,
which in turn serves a single consolidated JS file from components foo.js, bar.js, baz.js,
in order.
* URL -> URI
* Used throughout almost all of the code (except RemoteContentFetcher - TBD)
* Cleanups and Tweaks
* Registering AnalyticsFeature in its own class.
* Returning SC_BAD_REQUEST in a few relevant places in the rendering servlet.
* Cleaned up some MessageBundle naming-related issues by renaming GadgetSpec.MessageBundle to GadgetSpec.LocaleSpec (Locale is taken already).
* Created Check static class to perform argument/state checking.
* ParsedGadgetSpec enforces correct content-type in getContentHref/Data().
* Switched to JUnit 4.4.
* Added Hamcrest matching package 1.1.
Contributors to this change: etnu@google.com, wangz@google.com, dharkness@google.com, fargo@google.com
